newsitem.title: USA: Cooper Hospital, N.J., talks to Allegheny -- paper.
newsitem.headline: Cooper Hospital, N.J., talks to Allegheny -- paper.

text.p: The Cooper Health System of Camden, N.J., has met with Pittsburgh's Allegheny Health, Education, and Research Foundation to discuss a partnership, the Philadelphia Inquirer reported Tuesday.
The talks are preliminary, but reflect Cooper's realization that it needs to become part of a larger organization to survive, the newspaper said.
Allegheny, one of Pennsylvania's largest hospital chains, has previously said it intends to make a push into the South Jersey health care market.

Cooper sold nearly $70 million of bonds for an expansion in February, when it told potential bond buyers that audits had uncovered about $22 million of fraud. The hospital recently turned over details of the audit to state officials, but has declined to release the audit to the public.
